IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The College provides a Christian based environment suitable for learning, it provides excellent liberal arts and religious programs for students from all ethnic backgrounds designed to develop their potential for leadership and service to a global community.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The College provides a Christian based environment suitable for learning, it provides a liberal arts and religious programs for students from all ethnic backgrounds designed to develop their potential for leadership and service to a global community.
IRS990.Description: The organization is an institution of higher learning and provides instruction, scholarships and various support services in achieving its primary purpose.

Activity2.Description: Auxiliary enterprises support the Colleges mission of providing quality educational opportunities. These services include but are not limted to food service, campus housing, campus post office, vending, campus stores and athletics.

OtherLiabilities.Description: Advance from A M E Zion Church

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Permanently restricted, College does not intend to use.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The College admits students of any race, national or ethnic origin. The College does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin in the administration of its educational policies, scholarships or loan programs, and athletic and school administered programs. The Colleges non-discrimination statement appears in all brochures and applications for admission.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The College offers scholarships and student financial aid to assist with meeting the students financial obligations. The Financial Aid Office has the necessary policies and procedures to ensure that the College adheres to and complies with federal regulations regarding eligibility for student financial aid. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend on other factors such as grade point average, family income, or athletic talents. The College has adequate staff in its other grant programs with eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required OMB Circular A-133 audit.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Trustees are required to disclose at the next convening Boar of Trustees meeting any conflict of interest. Board members witha conflict of interest with a matter for vote must abstain from voting. The Colleges audit committee is responsible for ensuring adherence to the policy.

The Board of Trustees, based on predetermined areas of performance evaluates the work of the President annually. The Boards Evaluation and Compensation Committee evaluates the perforamce. When additional compensation is deemed appropriate, a review of salaries at peer institutions is conducted to assist in arriving at a recommendation to the Executive Committee for approval.

Compensation for top officers of the College is at the discretion of the President. this discretion is based on 1 previous salary history and 2 market data from the CUPA survey published in the Chronicle of Higher Education.
The College presents the Form 990 to its finance/audit committee for review upon completion.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Schedule E Form 990 or 990-EZ Financial Aid or Government Assistance
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Line 6a The org receives aid, Line 6b The org has had their aid revoked or suspended.
